original_solution_mapping.L1: Oscar needs to increase his maximum running time from 20 - 2 = <<20-2=18>>18 miles.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Oscar will need a total of 18 / ( 2 / 3 ) = <<18/(2/3)=27>>27 weeks to prepare.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 390.
    Returns: the number of weeks Oscar needs to train before the marathon.
    """
    # L1
    target_distance = 20 # reaches a 20-mile run
    current_distance = 2 # he has already run 2 miles
    distance_to_increase = target_distance - current_distance

    # L2
    weekly_increase_fraction = Fraction(2, 3) # add 2/3 of a mile each week
    weeks_needed = distance_to_increase / weekly_increase_fraction

    # FA
    answer = weeks_needed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Oscar needs to increase his maximum running time from {target_distance} - {current_distance} = <<{target_distance}-{current_distance}={distance_to_increase}>>{distance_to_increase} miles.
Oscar will need a total of {distance_to_increase} / ( {weekly_increase_fraction} ) = <<{distance_to_increase}/({weekly_increase_fraction})={weeks_needed}>>{weeks_needed} weeks to prepare.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Oscar needs to increase his maximum running time from 20 - 2 = <<20-2=22>>22 miles.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Oscar will need a total of 22 / ( 2/3 ) = <<22/(2/3)=33>>33 weeks to prepare.

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '-' but used '+' instead.
